tickerNews.title: INDF: Net Profit Driven by Exchange Gains, Operations Remain Solid
tickerNews.content: Indofood Sukses Makmur ([INDF]) recorded a relatively strong net profit of 4.9 trillion rupiah (+224% YoY, +249% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result caused the net profit for 9M24 to rise to 8.8 trillion rupiah (+24% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 90%/94% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimates. The strong net profit in 3Q24 was driven by foreign exchange gains of 3.4 trillion rupiah following the strengthening of the rupiah against the US dollar from 16,421 per the end of June 2024 to 15,138 per the end of September 2024. This exchange gain reversed the situation from the previous quarter, where INDF's net profit in 2Q24 was suppressed by exchange losses. Operationally, operating profit grew in 3Q24 to 5.3 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY, +3% QoQ). This result brought the operating profit for 9M24 to 16.3 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY) and exceeded expectations as it equates to 83%/73% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimates, higher than the historical range of 72%. Generally, operating profit growth was due to revenue growth and maintained profitability. Revenue Growth Driven by ICBP and Agribusiness Segments. INDF's revenue increased to 29.6 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY, +12% QoQ) in 3Q24, resulting in revenue for 9M24 rising +4% YoY to 87 trillion rupiah, or equivalent to 74%/75% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimates. Revenue growth was mainly driven by the consumer branded products segment under the main subsidiary, Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur ([ICBP]), which recorded relatively solid revenue growth at 18.8 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY, +9% QoQ) in 3Q24 and 55.6 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY) during 9M24. Additionally, the agribusiness segment also recorded solid quarterly revenue growth in 3Q24, amounting to +28% QoQ. Profitability Maintained, Supported by Agribusiness Segment. INDF's operating profit margin increased by +27 bps YoY to 17.7% in 3Q24, although it decreased by -149 bps QoQ. This result is still above our estimate which projects an operating profit margin of 16.8% for FY24. By segment, INDF's operating profit margin was supported by the performance of the agribusiness segment, which recorded an operating profit margin increase nearly 2 times to 22.4%/16.8% in 3Q24/9M24. The strong margin in the agribusiness segment can compensate for the weak margins from the other 3 segments, which experienced a decrease in operating profit margin respectively. We estimate that the strong margin in the agribusiness segment is due to the rise in CPO prices by about +6% during 3Q24, while the weak margin in the ICBP segment is estimated to be triggered by the increase in wheat prices by about +6% during 3Q24. Key Takeaway. In the previous quarter, we wrote that INDF's prospects in 2H24 have the potential to improve due to the recovery of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar which will reverse exchange losses, which has now been reflected in the 3Q24 performance. We identify 2 main factors that have the potential to affect INDF's performance in 4Q24: Risk of rupiah weakening against the US dollar which could cause INDF to record exchange losses. Currently, the rupiah against the US dollar is at the level of 15,700, weakening by about -4% compared to the closing of 3Q24. More favorable wheat and CPO prices open opportunities for maintained FY24 margins higher than our estimates. Wheat prices during October 2024 remained below 6 US dollars per bushel (vs. our assumption: 6.20 US dollars per bushel) can maintain the ICBP margin. From the agribusiness segment, margins can increase along with CPO prices which rose by about +15% in the last month to 4,700 Malaysian ringgit per ton (vs. our assumption: 3,700 Malaysian ringgit per ton).

tickerNews.title: ADRO 9M24: Net Profit -3% YoY, Better Than Expected
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia ([ADRO]) recorded a net profit of 404 million US dollars (+17.1% YoY, -0.1% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 1.2 billion US dollars (-3% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 82%/96% of the FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. ADRO's revenue of -3.3% QoQ in 3Q24 and -10.6% YoY over 9M24 was much better than our expectation (-12.8% YoY) and consensus (-19.3% YoY) for FY24F. We estimate this result was supported by increased sales volume, considering that the Indonesian Coal Index (ICI) tended to stagnate in 3Q24. ADRO's gross profit margin at 37.1% in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: 37.9%) and 39.5% during 9M24 (vs. 9M23: 39.9%) was also better than our expectation which projected 38.4% for FY24F. We estimate that ADRO's cash cost during 9M24 was still below our expectation at 48.5 US dollars per ton, although it likely increased quarterly.

tickerNews.title: ANTM 3Q24 Net Profit -50.4% QoQ, 9M24 Net Profit -22.7% YoY, Better Than Consensus Expectations
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang ([ANTM]) recorded a net profit of 650 billion rupiah (-50.4% QoQ, -32.1% YoY) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 2.2 trillion rupiah (-22.7% YoY), better than expectations as it equates to 88% of the consensus FY24F estimates. The decrease in net profit in 3Q24 was suppressed by exchange losses of 428 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q24: profit 327 billion rupiah). Operationally, ANTM produced ferronickel of 5.08 tons (-5.7% QoQ, -3.3% YoY) in 3Q24, with nickel ore production of 3.1 million wmt (+13.7% QoQ, -16.6% YoY), and gold production of 9,774 troy ounces (+11.4% QoQ, -3.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MAPA 9M24 Net Profit +8% YoY, Exceeding Expectations Driven by Revenue Acceleration, Margin Improvement, and Forex Gains
tickerNews.content: MAP Aktif Adiperkasa ([MAPA]) recorded a net profit of 515 billion rupiah (+40% YoY, +68% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result caused the net profit for 9M24 to become 1.1 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 79% of the consensus FY24F estimate (vs. net profit seasonality 2022-2023 only 69-73% at 9M). The increase in net profit in 3Q24 was driven by: 1) accelerated revenue growth (+25% YoY, +8% QoQ); 2) increased operating profit margin (-96 bps YoY, +230 bps QoQ) from efficiency and operating leverage; and 3) other income from foreign exchange gains of 59 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: loss 5 billion rupiah, 2Q24: loss 35 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: MAPI 3Q24 Net Profit Flat YoY, 9M24 Net Profit -8% YoY, Below Expectations Due to Weakened Operating Margin
tickerNews.content: Mitra Adiperkasa ([MAPI]) recorded a net profit of 401 billion rupiah (+0% YoY, -17% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result caused the net profit for 9M24 to become 1.3 trillion rupiah (-8% YoY), below expectations as it equates to 68% of the consensus FY24F estimate (9M22-9M23 net profit seasonality: 74-75%). Revenue in 3Q24 grew to 9.6 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY, +5% QoQ), so revenue for 9M24 grew +16% YoY to 27.6 trillion rupiah. The sluggish net profit in 3Q24 was due to a weakening operating profit margin to 8% (-213 bps YoY, -179 bps QoQ), mainly due to losses in the Cafe & Restaurant segment and a decrease in operating profit in the Fashion & Digital segment.

tickerNews.title: INKP 3Q24 Records Net Loss of 53 Million USD, First Loss Since 2Q11; 9M24 Net Profit -30% YoY
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper ([INKP]) recorded a net loss of 53 million US dollars in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: net profit 148 million US dollars, 3Q23: net profit 52 million US dollars), marking the first loss since 2Q11. This result caused the net profit for 9M24 to become 226 million US dollars (-30% YoY). The loss in 3Q24 was suppressed by exchange losses of 157 million US dollars (vs. 2Q24: profit 50 million US dollars, 3Q23: profit 33 million US dollars). Operationally, operating profit reached 162 million US dollars in 3Q24 (-12% QoQ, +43% YoY). This realization brought operating profit for 9M24 to 529 million US dollars (-15% YoY). The quarterly operating profit decrease was mainly caused by: 1) decrease in pulp selling price; and 2) increase in opex.

tickerNews.title: TKIM 3Q24 Records Net Loss of 113 Million USD, First Loss Since 4Q20; 9M24 Net Profit -23% YoY
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia ([TKIM]) recorded a net loss of 113 million US dollars in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: net profit 111 million US dollars, 3Q23: net profit 70 million US dollars), marking the first loss since 4Q20. This result caused the net profit for 9M24 to become 103 million US dollars (-23% YoY). The loss in 3Q24 was suppressed by exchange losses of 53 million US dollars (2Q24: profit 19 million US dollars, 3Q23: 21 million US dollars). Additionally, TKIM's joint venture (OKI Pulp) recorded a loss of 52 million US dollars (vs. 2Q24: profit 81 million US dollars, 3Q23: profit 48 million US dollars). The profit decrease from OKI Pulp potentially resulted from exchange losses, considering OKI Pulp recorded foreign exchange gains of 148 million US dollars in 1H24.

tickerNews.title: INCO 3Q24 Net Profit -77% YoY, Below Expectations, Driven by Higher COGS Amidst Revenue Decline
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia ([INCO]) recorded a net profit of 17 million US dollars (-77% YoY, -44% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 51 million US dollars (-78.6% YoY), below expectations as it only met 63%/58% of the FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. The decrease in net profit in 3Q24 was mainly suppressed by an increase in cost of revenue (+1.9% QoQ) amid a decrease in revenue (-7.6% QoQ) due to a decrease in average selling price (ASP) of -8.9% QoQ, although sales volume increased by +1.4% QoQ. The increase in cost of revenue was driven by an increase in fuel and lubricant costs by +9.3% QoQ, which was mainly caused by an increase in the usage volume of high sulphur fuel oil (HSFO) to 21.9 barrels per ton of production (+2.6% QoQ) and an increase in HSFO ASP (+5.5% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: HRUM 3Q24 Net Profit Reverses YoY Loss, 9M24 Net Profit -34.8% YoY, Meeting 56% of Consensus Estimate
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy ([HRUM]) recorded a net profit of 32.6 million US dollars (-10.5% YoY) in 3Q24, reversing from a net loss of 43.3 million US dollars in 3Q23. This result made the net profit for 9M24 reach 69.9 million US dollars (-34.8% YoY), equivalent to 56% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The decrease in net profit in 3Q24 was caused by an increase in cost of revenue (+17.6% QoQ) and an increase in opex (+19.2% QoQ) which were higher than revenue growth (+12.9% QoQ), causing the operating profit margin in 3Q24 to fall to 14.4% (vs. 2Q24: 17.9%).

tickerNews.title: AMRT 3Q24 Net Profit +5% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit +10% YoY In Line with Expectations; Operating Margin Decreases Due to Lower Other Income
tickerNews.content: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya ([AMRT]) recorded a net profit of 604 billion rupiah (+5% YoY, -33% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 2.4 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY), in line with expectations as it equates to 59% of the consensus FY24F estimate (9M21-9M23 net profit seasonality vs. FY: 57-64%). Revenue grew to 29 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY, -3% QoQ), so revenue for 9M24 became 88.2 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY) and is still in line with expectations as it equates to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate (9M21-9M23 revenue seasonality vs. FY: 74-75%). Revenue growth was experienced in all operating regions, mainly driven by growth in regions outside Java which grew +16% YoY. The operating profit margin decreased to 2.7% in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: 2.9%, 2Q24: 3.9%) due to a decrease in other income to 287 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: 337 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: MIDI 3Q24 Net Profit +8% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit +20% YoY In Line with Expectations; Operating Margin Slightly Decreased
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia ([MIDI]) recorded a net profit of 142 billion rupiah (+8% YoY, -14% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 467 billion rupiah (+20% YoY), in line with expectations as it equates to 75% of the consensus FY24F estimate (9M22-9M23 net profit seasonality vs. FY: 76-77%). Revenue grew to 4.9 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY, -2% QoQ), so revenue for 9M24 became 27.6 trillion rupiah (+14% YoY). Revenue was driven by same store sales growth (SSSG) of +11.07% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 1H24: +9.64% YoY). Double-digit revenue growth was achieved in all operational regions: outside Java (+23% YoY), Jabodetabek (+17% YoY), and Java outside Jabodetabek (+10% YoY). The operating profit margin slightly decreased to 3.8% (-47 bps YoY, -57 bps QoQ) in 3Q24 and 4.1% (-28 bps YoY) during 9M24, suppressed by a decrease in other income to 55 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: 93 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: BREN 9M24 Net Profit +2% YoY, Operating Profit Slightly Increased Due to Sidrap Wind Power Plant Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy ([BREN]) recorded a net profit of 28 million US dollars (+5% YoY, -3% QoQ) in 3Q24, so the net profit for 9M24 became 86 million US dollars (+2% YoY). Operationally, operating profit (+1% YoY, +5% QoQ) in 3Q24 rose slightly along with increased revenue (+5% YoY, +2% QoQ) due to additional revenue from the Sidrap Wind Power Plant newly acquired in 1Q24.

tickerNews.title: CTRA 3Q24 Net Profit -38% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit +8% YoY, Operating Profit Growth Limited by OPEX Increase
tickerNews.content: Ciputra Development ([CTRA]) recorded a net profit of 248 billion rupiah (-38% YoY, -55% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 reach 1.3 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY), equivalent to 61% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operating profit in 3Q24 decreased (-30% YoY, -42% QoQ) due to a decrease in revenue (-2% YoY, -24% QoQ) and an increase in opex (+20% YoY, +10% QoQ). However, operating profit during 9M24 still recorded growth of +3% YoY. The thin growth in operating profit during 9M24 was caused by an increase in opex (+12% YoY) exceeding revenue growth (+8% YoY), causing the operating profit margin to decline by -140 bps YoY.

tickerNews.title: BSDE 3Q24 Net Profit -35% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit +53% YoY In Line with Expectations; Operating Profit Increased Due to High Revenue Recognition
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai ([BSDE]) recorded a net profit of 369 billion rupiah (-35% YoY, -59% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 reach 2.7 trillion rupiah (+53% YoY), in line with expectations as it equates to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operating profit in 3Q24 decreased (-4% YoY, -50% QoQ) due to low commercial segment handover seasonality, resulting in quarterly revenue decline (+17% YoY, -24% QoQ) which was insufficient to offset the increase in opex. However, operating profit during 9M24 reached 3.6 trillion rupiah (+58% YoY) from high revenue recognition growth (+38% YoY) and operating profit margin expansion (+450 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: KLBF 3Q24 Net Profit +7% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit +15% YoY In Line with Expectations; Weak YoY Growth Due to Increased Operational Expenses
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma ([KLBF]) recorded a net profit of 573 billion rupiah (+7% YoY, -32% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 2.3 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY), in line with expectations as it equates to 73% of the consensus FY24F estimate (vs. 9M23: 75% of FY23 net profit). The annual net profit growth during 9M24 is in the upper range of the FY24 management guidance of +13-15%. The relatively weak annual net profit growth in 3Q24 was mainly caused by an increase in operating expenses, equivalent to ~28% of total revenue (vs. 3Q23: ~27% of total revenue), amidst a gross profit margin increase to 39% (vs. 3Q23: 37%, 2Q24: 39%). Consequently, operating profit only reached 677 billion rupiah (+3% YoY, -35% QoQ) in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: TOWR 3Q24 Operating Profit +4% YoY, 9M24 Operating Profit +4% YoY Exceeding Expectations; Net Profit Suppressed by Forex Losses and Other Expenses
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara ([TOWR]) recorded a net profit of 842 billion rupiah (-12% YoY, +4% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 2.4 trillion rupiah (+1% YoY), below expectations as it equates to 70% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The weak net profit in 3Q24 was suppressed by foreign exchange losses recorded in other business expenses of 82 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: profit 7 billion rupiah, 2Q24: loss 41 billion rupiah) and other expenses rising to 141 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: 61 billion rupiah, 2Q24: 26 billion rupiah). Operationally, operating profit increased to 2 trillion rupiah (+4% YoY, +8% QoQ) in 3Q24, so operating profit for 9M24 became 5.7 trillion rupiah (+4% YoY) and exceeded expectations as it equates to 76% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This growth was most likely driven by additional profit from Inti Bangun Sejahtera ([IBST]) which was newly acquired in 2Q24.

tickerNews.title: MPMX 9M24 Net Profit +5% YoY Slightly Below Expectations, Impacted by Forex Loss and JV Loss
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika ([MPMX]) recorded a net profit of 114 billion rupiah (-28% YoY, -30% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 become 441 billion rupiah (+5% YoY), slightly below our expectations as it equates to 74% of the Stockbit FY24F estimate (vs. 9M23 net profit: 80% of FY23). Revenue in 3Q24 grew (+22% YoY, +9% QoQ), while net profit performance was suppressed further by a forex loss of 30 billion rupiah and a JV loss of 21 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ASRI 3Q24 Net Loss of 6 Billion Rupiah, 9M24 Net Profit -90% YoY Eroded by Forex and Other Losses
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty ([ASRI]) recorded a net loss of 6 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: profit 43 billion rupiah, 2Q24: loss 23 billion rupiah), suppressed by low revenue recognition (-28% YoY, -31% QoQ) and an increase in financial expenses (+1% YoY, +45% QoQ). Over 9M24, ASRI's net profit decreased by -90% YoY, eroded by exchange losses and others reaching 198 billion rupiah (vs. 9M23: profit 30 billion rupiah). Meanwhile, revenue recognition during 9M24 grew slightly (+2% YoY) along with an increase in opex (+5%), causing operating profit to decline (-4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: POWR 3Q24 Net Profit +92% YoY, Driven by Forex Gain and Deferred Tax Reversal; Operating Profit Down Due to Lower Electricity Sales Volume to PLN
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo ([POWR]) recorded a net profit of 39 million US dollars (+92% YoY, +155% QoQ) in 3Q24, so the net profit for 9M24 became 73 million US dollars (-5% YoY). The recovery in net profit in 3Q24 was due to foreign exchange gains of 4 million US dollars (vs. 2Q24: loss 1 million US dollars, 3Q23: loss 2 million US dollars) and the reversal of deferred tax expense of 11.5 million US dollars (2Q24: expense 5 million US dollars, 3Q23: reversal 5 million US dollars). Operationally, operating profit decreased (-3% YoY, +21% QoQ) in 3Q24 due to a decrease in electricity sales volume to PLN (-23% YoY, -5% QoQ) of 181 GWh. Meanwhile, the industrial segment recorded an increase in electricity sales volume (+3% YoY, +9% QoQ) to 873 GWh in 3Q24.
